detailed_results.input: The industrial system can guarantee that a critical failure will never occur.
The autonomous vehicle can guarantee that sooner or later it will reach the destination.
The industrial system and the operator together can guarantee that sooner or later production will be restored.
The satellite and the ground station together can guarantee that sooner or later the data will be downloaded.
The robot number 3 has a strategy to guarantee that they will reach position 2 in the next step.

The Romans, in the countries which they annexed, observed closely these measures; they sent colonies and maintained friendly relations with the minor powers, without increasing their strength; they kept down the greater, and did not allow any strong foreign powers to gain authority.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction changes the coalition intent (the gold uses <<Romans>> but the temporal structure is completely different), incorrectly uses F for 'annexed' (which is a past condition, not a future guarantee), and omits key conjuncts (send-colony, keep_down_the_greater) while adding an unrelated temporal operator G on only one part. The gold expresses a persistent guarantee of three concurrent actions; the prediction does not capture this meaning.

detailed_results.input: The network system can guarantee that critical packet loss will never occur.
The robot number 3 has a strategy to force that eventually position 2 holds and never position 4 afterwards.
The system and the controller together can guarantee that sooner or later consumption will be reduced.

The temporal operator F and the predicate consumption_reduced are identical, preserving the meaning of 'sooner or later consumption will be reduced'.

detailed_results.input: Given three robots, none of them has a strategy to ensure that whenever position 2 holds, position 1 will hold in the next step.
detailed_results.gold: !<<Robot1>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot2>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot3>> G (pos2 -> X pos1)
detailed_results.reasoning: The input states that none of the three robots has the ability to ensure the property. The gold formula correctly negates the ATL operator for each robot. The prediction asserts that Robot1 can ensure the property, which is the exact opposite meaning (wrong polarity on the coalition operator).

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that if a stop is requested, then at the next step it will stop moving.
The system and the administrator together can guarantee that sooner or later security will be restored.
detailed_results.reasoning: The coalition 'SecuritySystem,Admin' and 'System,Administrator' refer to the same agents from the natural language description ('the system and the administrator'). The temporal operator F (eventually) and the predicate 'security_restored' are identical. The slight naming variation in the agent labels does not change the semantic intent.

detailed_results.input: The climate control system can guarantee that sooner or later the temperature will return to a stable state.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (ClimateSystem), same temporal operator (F for 'sooner or later'), and predicate 'stable_temperature' is a clear synonym for 'temperature_stable' from the input.

detailed_results.input: The Parties agree that an armed attack against one or more of them in Europe or North America shall be considered an attack against them all and consequently they agree that, if such an armed attack occurs, each of them, in exercise of the right of individual or collective self-defence recognised by Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations, will assist the Party or Parties so attacked by taking forthwith, individually and in concert with the other Parties, such action as it deems necessary, including the use of armed force, to restore and maintain the security of the North Atlantic area.
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula uses an until structure (attack U security_restored) to express that the Parties can guarantee that an attack condition persists until security is restored. The prediction changes the temporal structure to a globally scoped implication (G (armed_attack -> F security_restored)), which means that whenever an armed attack occurs, eventually security will be restored. This is a weaker guarantee (eventually vs. until) and does not require the attack condition to hold continuously until restoration. Additionally, the coalition is singular ('Party') instead of plural ('Parties'), altering the agent set. The polarity and connective changes also affect the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to guarantee that it will keep position 1 until move is true and while not attack.
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula expresses that pos1 holds until both 'move' is true and 'attack' is false. The prediction changes the condition to 'move -> pos2', which is a different property (pos1 holds until a conditional about pos2 is true). This alters the meaning significantly, as the original involves a conjunction with a negation (!attack), while the prediction introduces an implication and a new predicate pos2.

detailed_results.input: The satellite can guarantee that sooner or later it will establish a link with the ground station.
The machine can guarantee that if the payment does not occur, the ticket will never be printed.
The robotic arm can guarantee that if the object is grasped, then at the next step it will start transport.
The autonomous vehicle can guarantee that it will never exceed the speed limit.
The control system can guarantee that it will keep regulating until the error becomes zero.
The rover can guarantee that when it is ready to sample, at the next step it will start sampling.
The mobile robot can guarantee that sooner or later it will reach the charging station.
The system and the operators together can guarantee that sooner or later the area will be secured.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition 'EmergencySystem,Operators' vs 'System,Operator' is a minor syntactic variation referring to the same collective agents from the input. The temporal operator F (eventually) and the predicate 'area_secured' are identical. The meaning is preserved.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 1 and number 2 together have a strategy to ensure in the next step not position 5 and not position 4.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction lacks parentheses around the conjunction, changing the scope of the temporal operator. The gold formula means 'in the next step, both not pos5 and not pos4 hold'. The prediction, due to operator precedence, is interpreted as (<<Robot1, Robot2>> X !pos5) && !pos4, which means 'the coalition can ensure !pos5 in the next step, and !pos4 holds now (globally, outside their strategy)'. This changes the meaning significantly.

detailed_results.input: The satellite can guarantee that it will keep adjusting attitude until the antenna is aligned.
Robots number 1 and number 2 have a joint strategy to always avoid position 3.
The robot number 3 has a strategy to ensure that eventually position 2 holds and then in the next step position 1 holds.
The coalition of robots 2 and 3 has a strategy to ensure that eventually either attack or defend holds and not retreat.
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula requires that eventually (F) the condition ((attack || defend) && !retreat) holds. The prediction only requires that eventually (attack || defend) holds, with no constraint on retreat. This changes the meaning because the gold formula explicitly forbids retreat at the same time, while the prediction allows retreat to hold simultaneously with attack or defend. The negation (!retreat) is missing, altering the expressed property.

detailed_results.input: The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition changed from 'Lord' to 'Robot', which alters the agent responsible for the guarantee. The predicate 'fulfilled' vs 'purpose_fulfilled' is a minor synonym difference, but the agent mismatch is semantically incorrect.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 2 and number 3 have a strategy to guarantee that they will eventually reach position 1 and eventually reach position 2.
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula requires that both 'eventually pos1' and 'eventually pos2' hold, possibly at different times. The prediction F (pos1 && F pos2) requires that eventually a state is reached where pos1 holds and from there eventually pos2 holds, which is a stronger condition (pos1 must occur before or at the same time as the start of the path to pos2). This changes the meaning from two independent eventualities to a sequential one.

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that the gate will never open without payment.

The temporal operator and coalition are correct, but the logical condition is missing, changing the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that it will never cause a collision with a human.

The prediction uses '!collision', which could refer to any collision (e.g., with objects, other robots), weakening the intended safety guarantee about human interaction. This changes the expressed property.

detailed_results.input: Therefore, take me and bind me to the crosspiece half way up the mast; bind me as I stand upright, with a bond so fast that I cannot possibly break away, and lash the rope’s ends to the mast itself. If I beg and pray you to set me free, then bind me more tightly still.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction is completely incorrect. It changes the coalition (from Odysseus to Robot1, Robot2), the temporal operator (from G to F), and the entire logical structure (from a conditional guarantee about binding to an eventual task completion). The gold formula captures a guarantee that whenever Odysseus is bound and praying, he will be bound more tightly, which matches the narrative instruction. The prediction expresses a different property about two robots eventually completing a task, which has no semantic relation to the input.

detailed_results.input: The warehouse and the courier together can guarantee that sooner or later the package will be shipped.
The robot number 1 does not have a strategy to ensure that position 3 will eventually hold when position 2 holds now.

The prediction states that Robot1 has a strategy to eventually make it true that (if pos2 holds then pos3 holds). This flips the polarity of the strategic ability (negation missing) and changes the temporal scope: the gold's F is inside the strategy, triggered by pos2 now; the prediction's F is the outermost temporal operator, making the implication a future condition, not a guarantee from the current state when pos2 holds. This changes the expressed property.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to ensure that eventually reach position 1.
The robotic arm can guarantee that it will keep aligning until the object is aligned.
The robotic arm can guarantee that if the target position changes, then at the next step it will start replanning.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Arm), same temporal structure (G (p -> X q)). The predicates 'target_changed' vs 'target_position_changed' and 'replanning' vs 'replanning_started' are clear synonyms from the sentence context, preserving the intended meaning.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to guarantee that it will eventually reach position 1 or position 2.
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula <<Robot1>> F (pos1 || pos2) means the robot can guarantee that eventually a state is reached where it is at position 1 OR position 2. The prediction <<Robot1>> (F pos1 || F pos2) means the robot can guarantee that either eventually it reaches position 1 OR eventually it reaches position 2. The latter is weaker: it allows the strategy to depend on which disjunct is satisfied, potentially requiring different strategies for each possibility, whereas the gold requires a single strategy that ensures one of the positions is reached eventually. In ATL, <<A>>(φ ∨ ψ) is not equivalent to (<<A>>φ ∨ <<A>>ψ). Therefore, the prediction changes the meaning.

Nobody else could have got in this way, as this entrance was meant only for you [K.]. Now I'll go and close it.
